title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message:
Owner says the battery went flat, then they charged it and opened it up, but nothing comes up on screen. When switching in now, gives a good dong so you can tell it is switched on, knocking a few keys on the keyboard and it gives error sounds so it has loaded to at least the log on screen.
After diagnosis and testing, the story so far from moving backwards from the lcd connecter: [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Need to see if voltage is getting to the screen[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]It knows when the screen has been closed as it goes to sleep when you close it[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]The screen does not come back on when you open it, but it does wake up[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is the screen/graphics being told to switch on?[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is there pp3v3_sw_lcd there? At pins 2 and 3 of lcd connector?[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is at pin 3[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is the voltage there for the backlight at pins 38 39 40? [/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]0.02v is there[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is there pp3v3_so at r9010 r9011 c9010[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Yes it is, the components test all ok[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is there PP3V3_SW_LCD_UF at:[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]l9000 no[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]c9001 no[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]c9002 no[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]c9011 no[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]c9012 no[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Components test ok though[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]U9000[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is there 3v3 at pin 2 3 4 5[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Voltages only at pin 2 and 3 so PP3V3_S5 is working[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Pin 4 and 5 are output[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is there PP3V3_S5 at pin 1 or 2 of c9009[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Correct voltage is at pin 1[/FONT][/COLOR] [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Is lcd_pwr_en at r9094[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]No voltage at that component[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Need to find source of lcd_pwr_en[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]Comes from u9600[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]U9701 (lp 8550) looks like it might be burnt out, this is for the led backlight

So up to now it looks like it has a backlight AND graphics problem, I haven't done any testing for backlight yet other than seeing that lp8550 is burnt out

Can u9600 be reflowed/reballed or will it need replacing?

The device isn't liquid damaged, I can't quiye believe the issue it has would come from the battery going flat, but there you go.
So I am just wondering what to do about u9600 to at least get the graphics back then tackle the backlight.

Thanks for reading.[/FONT][/COLOR]

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: What area was liquid damaged? Is there video on external screen?

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: It isn't liquid damaged at all, sorry, read my previous post and corrected it, no adapter at the moment. I will get an adapter and update again.

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: I would say this would qualify for the Apple recall program then. Take it to Apple.

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: What programme is that? Is it on their website?

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: Just found it. I'd like to give the repair a go, but with the risks involved, I had best bow out instead.

title: Macbook pro 820-2915 board
message: Just as an update to this, it has gone to Apple. Connecting an external display didn't give any change.
